perturbation.original_text: 2. Covenants Not to Compete. (a) Member specifically acknowledges that, pursuant to the Franchise Agreement, and by virtue of its position with Franchisee, Member will receive valuable specialized training and Confidential Information, including, without limitation, information regarding the operational, sales, promotional, and marketing methods and techniques of Franchisor and the System. (b) Member covenants and agrees that during the term of the Franchise Agreement, except as otherwise approved in writing by Franchisor, Member shall not, either directly or indirectly, for itself, or through, on behalf of, or in conjunction with any person, persons, partnership, corporation, or entity: (i) Own, manage, engage in, be employed by, advise, make loans to, consult for, rent or lease to, or have any other interest in business that (directly or indirectly) operates, or grants franchises or licenses to operate, a restaurant featuring pizza and related food specialties or that offers products or services substantially similar to those then offered by Pizza Fusions Restaurants ("Competitive Business");
perturbation.changed_text: 2. Covenants Not to Compete. (a) Member specifically acknowledges that, pursuant to the Franchise Agreement, and by virtue of its position with Franchisee, Member may receive some training and general information. (b) Member covenants and agrees that during the first year of the Franchise Agreement, except as otherwise stipulated, Member may, either directly or indirectly, for itself, or through, on behalf of, or in conjunction with any person, persons, partnership, corporation, or entity: (i) Own, manage, engage in, be employed by, advise, make loans to, consult for, rent or lease to, or have any other interest in business that (directly or indirectly) operates, or grants franchises or licenses to operate, a restaurant featuring pizza and related food specialties or that offers some of the products or services similar to those then offered by Pizza Fusions Restaurants ("Competitive Business");
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces contradictions by changing the acknowledgment of 'valuable specialized training and Confidential Information' to 'some training and general information,' contradicting the premise for the non-compete agreement. Additionally, the non-compete period is limited to the first year, conflicting with the later definition of the "Post-Term Period" which is defined as two years, creating ambiguity and uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: (d) As used in this Agreement, the term "Post-Term Period" shall mean a continuous uninterrupted period of two (2) years from the date of: (a) a transfer permitted under Section 14 of the Franchise Agreement; (b) expiration or termination of the Franchise Agreement (regardless of the cause for termination); (c) termination of Member's employment with Franchisee; and/or (d) a final order of a duly authorized arbitrator, panel of arbitrators, or a court of competent jurisdiction (after all appeals have been taken) with respect to any of the foregoing or with respect to the enforcement of this Agreement; either directly or indirectly (through, on behalf of, or in conjunction with any persons, partnership, corporation or entity).
perturbation.changed_text: (d) As used in this Agreement, the term "Post-Term Period" shall mean a continuous uninterrupted period of one (1) year from the date of: (a) a transfer permitted under Section 14 of the Franchise Agreement; (b) expiration or termination of the Franchise Agreement (only if terminated for cause); (c) termination of Member's employment with Franchisee (only if the member resigns); and/or (d) a final order of a duly authorized arbitrator, panel of arbitrators, or a court of competent jurisdiction (after initial judgement) with respect to any of the foregoing or with respect to the enforcement of this Agreement; either directly or indirectly (through, on behalf of, or in conjunction with any persons, partnership, corporation or entity).
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces several inconsistencies. The "Post-Term Period" is now defined as one year instead of two, contradicting the two-year period in the original. It also adds conditions to the Post-Term Period based on the termination and resignation, contradicting with the original which had no conditions on the enforcement.
